author: Joe Palazzolo
title: Trump’s Personal Lawyer Says Stormy Daniels Could Be Liable for $20 Million
text:
Published: Mar 17, 2018 8:47 a.m. ET Share Getty Images Adult film actress Stephanie Clifford, who uses the stage name Stormy Daniels, accepted $130,000 in return for remaining silent about an alleged affair with Donald Trump in 2006. 
By Joe Palazzolo Michael Rothfeld 
President Donald Trump’s personal lawyer said former adult-film actress Stephanie Clifford could be liable for damages of at least $20 million for breaching a nondisclosure agreement that barred her from discussing an alleged extramarital affair with Trump. 
The allegation came in a filing Friday in federal court in Los Angeles that accused Clifford of at least 20 violations of a 2016 contract reached between Clifford, known professionally as Stormy Daniels, and Michael Cohen, Trump’s personal attorney. 
Cohen paid Clifford $130,000 weeks before the 2016 presidential election in return for keeping silent about the alleged affair between her and Trump in 2006. 
The contract was signed between Cohen and Clifford in October 2016 and used pseudonyms to mask the identities of those involved. It states that she would be obligated to pay Trump directly—not Essential Consultants LLC, the limited liability company Cohen used as a conduit to pay her—for damages if she breached the contract. Clifford sued Trump and Essential Consultants in Los Angeles County Superior Court earlier this month in an attempt to invalidate the agreement.
